content: Assessing and selecting the right business based on applicant’s profile
Market research and data collection
Drafting marketing materials and business planning documents
Preparing HR and staffing documents
Developing a management plan
Writing a professional business plan aligned with provincial standards
Preparing financial forms according to SME standards
Collecting required documents and preparing a professional resume
Preparing official templates for required letters
Completing provincial application forms
Preparing and submitting EOI (Expression of Interest) to provinces
Identifying licensed Net-Worth Verifier companies in Canada
Coordinating and obtaining net-worth verification reports
Submitting official applications to provincial authorities
Guidance and preparation for interviews
Applying for work permits for applicants and spouses, and study permits for children
Submitting Permanent Residence applications
Receiving provincial nomination (Nomination Services)
Landing services, including assistance with opening a bank account, obtaining SIN, and other settlement needs
Coverage of government fees

Intro.title: Entrepreneurship in Canada
Intro.subtitle: Provincial Nominee Programs (PNP)
Intro.description: Canada is one of the world’s most attractive destinations for entrepreneurs. Through the Provincial Nominee Programs (PNP), Canadian provinces offer unique pathways for international entrepreneurs to establish or purchase a business and obtain permanent residency for themselves and their families.

whyStartBusiness.title: Why Start a Business in Canada?
points: Stable and growing economy with access to domestic and international markets
Continuous demand for foreign entrepreneurs to boost provincial growth
Strong government and provincial support, including tax incentives, investment opportunities, and solid infrastructure
Clear pathway to permanent residency for applicants and their families

requirements.title: General Requirements of Entrepreneurial PNP Programs
requirements.subtitle: While each province has its own specific rules, common requirements include

items.title: Job Creation
items.description: A commitment to create jobs for Canadians or permanent residents

services.title: Our Services for Entrepreneurs
services.description: At Novanest, we provide end-to-end support for your entrepreneurial journey in Canada:

points: ✔ Proven track record in investment & acceleration
